title: METHOD AND APPARATUS FOR RUNNING TWO TUBING STRINGS INTO A WELL
abstract: A well has a vertical casing (13) with a window (14), and a lateral wellbore which communicates with the window, and which may have a casing (18) or liner. A window assembly (31) aligned with the window (14) has respective passageways for first (51) and second (52) tubing strings, and has a concave surface (36) for deflecting the first tubing string out into the lateral wellbore. The passageway for the second tubing string has a portion which is inclined at a very small angle with respect to a vertical centerline of the vertical casing. As the first tubing string is run into the vertical casing, a rotational locator (126) is releasably coupled thereto by a soft release coupling mechanism (176). After the locator effects rotational orientation, the coupling mechanism (176) is released and then permits the first tubing string (51) to move therepast without damage. A seal assembly (56) on the first tubing string (51) is covered by a protective sleeve (147) as it is inserted into the well, and exits the protective sleeve (147) after entering the lateral wellbore.

motivations: There is a need for an efficient method to run multiple tubing strings into a well with a lateral wellbore.
Existing methods may cause damage to the tubing strings or the well casing during the installation process.
objectives: Develop a method and apparatus to safely and efficiently run two tubing strings into a well with a lateral wellbore.
Design a system that allows for precise control and protection of the tubing strings during the installation process.
methods: Utilize a window assembly with separate passageways for each tubing string and a concave surface to deflect the first tubing string into the lateral wellbore.
Employ a rotational locator with a soft release coupling mechanism to orient the first tubing string and then release it without damage.
Use a protective sleeve to cover a seal assembly on the first tubing string during insertion into the well.
results: Enable the efficient and safe installation of multiple tubing strings into a well with a lateral wellbore.
Reduce the risk of damage to the tubing strings and the well casing during the installation process.
llama_json.research_subject: Method and apparatus for installing multiple tubing strings in a well with a lateral wellbore

motivations: Running two tubing strings into a well can be challenging due to the need for precise orientation and protection from damage.
There is a need for a method that allows for the deflection of the first tubing string into a lateral wellbore without causing damage.
objectives: Develop a method and apparatus for running two tubing strings into a well, with one being deflected into a lateral wellbore.
Implement a rotational locator coupled to the first tubing string to ensure proper orientation.
Design a protective sleeve for the seal assembly on the first tubing string to prevent damage during insertion.
methods: Use a window assembly aligned with the window of the well casing to guide two tubing strings.
Employ a rotational locator releasably coupled to the first tubing string for rotational orientation.
Protect the seal assembly on the first tubing string with a protective sleeve during insertion.
results: Enable the successful and damage-free insertion of two tubing strings into a well.
Ensure proper orientation of the first tubing string into a lateral wellbore.
Protect the seal assembly on the first tubing string during insertion.
openai_json.research_subject: Method and apparatus for running two tubing strings into a well

motivations: Wells with lateral wellbores require specialized equipment to run multiple tubing strings through a single vertical casing window.
Existing methods for deploying tubing strings into lateral wellbores risk damage to seal assemblies and lack precise rotational orientation control.
objectives: Develop a method and apparatus for simultaneously running two tubing strings into a well with one string directed into a lateral wellbore.
Ensure protection of seal assemblies during deployment and enable precise rotational orientation of tubing strings.
methods: Design a window assembly with separate passageways for two tubing strings and a concave deflection surface for lateral wellbore entry.
Implement a releasable rotational locator with soft release coupling mechanism for orientation control.
Use a protective sleeve system to shield seal assemblies during insertion until they enter the lateral wellbore.
results: Enable efficient deployment of dual tubing strings with one string successfully directed into the lateral wellbore.
Achieve damage-free installation with protected seal assemblies and accurate rotational positioning.
anthropic_json.research_subject: Dual tubing string deployment system for wells with lateral wellbores
